2. Troubadour - +2 hand size, -1 hand per round
3. Card Sharp - X3 Mult if same hand played twice
4. Astronomer - Free planet cards
5. Flower Pot - X3 Mult if hand contains all 4 suits

**Analysis:**

I have:
- Pair of 8s (8 of Spades, 8 of Hearts)
- Pair of Aces (Ace of Hearts, Ace of Diamonds)
- Pair of 4s (4 of Spades, 4 of Diamonds)

So I have THREE PAIR! This means I can make a Two Pair.

I also have all four suits represented:
- Spades: 8, 4
- Hearts: Ace, 8, 6, 5
- Clubs: Queen


- Diamonds: Ace, Jack, 4

A Full House isn't possible without three of a kind. For Two Pair, I'd play the Aces and 8s as my strongest pairs. To trigger Flower Pot's X3 multiplier, I need all four suits in my hand, so I'd add the Queen of Clubs for the club suit, then pick either a spade or diamond to complete the coverage.

With Ace of Hearts, Ace of Diamonds, 8 of Spades, 8 of Hearts, and Queen of Clubs, I get all four suits. The base score from Two Pair is 80 chips plus 48 from the card values, and the Blue Joker adds 66 for 194 total chips. The multiplier comes to 15 (5 base × 3 from Flower Pot).

That gives me 2,910 chips—nowhere near the 30,000 I need. Using Card Sharp to repeat the hand would only get me to 11,640 chips combined. I should look at building a Full House instead, which means I need three of a kind. Let me check if I can discard strategically to create that.

I have pairs of Aces, Eights, and Fours with a few copies remaining in the deck. Aces and Eights each have 2 left, so those are my best shots. But with only 5 cards to draw and limited discards remaining, the probability of hitting the exact card I need is slim. Given that I have just 2 discards left and 3 hands total to play, I should focus on maximizing what I can actually achieve with my current hand rather than chasing unlikely outcomes.

Looking at my cards more carefully, I notice I'm holding four hearts—Ace, 8, 6, and 5. One more heart would give me a flush, and there are 7 hearts still in the 33-card deck. The odds aren't favorable enough to justify discarding for it. Instead, I should lean into my pairs. If I discard the non-pair cards and keep my matching cards, I have a better chance of drawing into three of a kind. For my next hand, I'll play my two pair—Aces and Eights—across all four suits with a Queen kicker to maximize the Flower Pot bonus.

Wait, let me verify the suits: Ace of Hearts and 8 of Hearts are both hearts, Ace of Diamonds, 8 of Spades, and Queen of Clubs. That covers all four suits perfectly. I'll go with this hand.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
